nodes.bodyText: Maybe we could extract this into a const in the types folder. Same with all other retry attempt numbers for more centralised management. Right now it just feels like a magic number to me.
What do you mean by team is missing sorry? Is there any particular reason this todo shouldn't be resolved in this PR?

Actually, I have no idea why the TODO is there since the no response panel has team names so I thought it was meant to be some sort of marker for some feature? Maybe the senior devs can shed some light on this.
Missing feature (I believe it is also missing in V6). If the question for a team, the no response panel will not count for that even the team a student belongs has responses.
Similar comment regarding magic number here
I don't think we should create any new retry method. this.loadCourses(); would already has the responsibility of setting this.hasCoursesLoaded and this.hasCoursesLoadingFailed to false.
Similar here and in other places also. What do you think?

I think that would work for the places where the retry calls one load only. Then the retry component just calls that load method. But there are some retry that does multiple load method calls like in student-course-details-page. I think the ones with multiple load calls would still benefit from having a retry method for both readability and ensuring the variable is set to false at one point only.
@xpdavid So what do you think about the suggestion above(i.e., single load be shifted but we keep retry method for multiple load calls)?
Yup. That would make more sense.
The variable should be set inside loadFeedbackSessionResults I think
Again, I think it is loadCandidatesCourse's responsibility to set hasCourseLoadingFailed and courseCandidates at the begining.
Any specific reason to promote courseId to class attribute?
This was so that I could call the loadStudentDetails method again

Can we be consistent on this?
Use DEFAULT_NUMBER_OF_RETRY_ATTEMPTS ?
